sentence.Network_en: No Irishman could hope to equal a Sicilian for cunning.
sentence.Network_cn: 就狡猾而言,没有哪一个爱尔兰人能够同一个西西里人相比.

sentence.Network_en: Even though you're not a Sicilian, I made you one.
sentence.Network_cn: 即使你生下来不是西西旱人, 我早把你熏陶成西西里人了.

sentence.Network_en: She was on her way to becoming a Sicilian.
sentence.Network_cn: 她正在养成西西里人的作风:有话不明说,大家心照不宣就得了.

entry.tran: 西西里的;西西里人的;西西里文化的
entry.def: Sicilian means belonging or relating to Sicily, or to its people or culture.

example.tran: 西西里岛科莱奥内镇的村庄

entry.tran: 西西里人;西西里岛人的后裔
entry.def: A Sicilian is a Sicilian citizen, or a person of Sicilian origin.

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or characteristic of Sicily or the people of Sicily;

auth_sentence.content: Exceedingly crude and simple methods prevail, and have prevailed since the days of the Romans, in the mining of Sicilian sulphur.
